articles.title: OpenAI launches ChatGPT 5.1 with 8 new personalities, warmer tone, and quicker replies
articles.author: Manisha Priyadarshini
articles.summary: OpenAI has officially launched its latest model update, GPT‑5.1. It's aimed at boosting speed, personality, and instruction-following in its flagship chat platform, ChatGPT. The model's rollout begins with paid subscribers (Pro, Plus, Business) and reaches free users in due course.

articles.title: Revealed: AI is being used by benefits claimants to maximise handouts
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being used by benefits claimants to maximise handouts. It is contributing to a welfare budget predicted to hit £100 billion a year by 2030. The Department for Work and Pensions has also deployed AI tools to help streamline decisions and decide whether individuals are eligible for benefits.

articles.title: What Analysts Believe Is Shaping the Evolving Story for SoundHound AI
articles.author: Simply Wall St
articles.summary: Piper Sandler raised its price target on SoundHound shares to $15 from $12 following the company's latest earnings release. The firm pointed to results that were slightly better than expected, with a large Internet of Things (IoT) win highlighted as a positive development. The company increased its full-year 2025 revenue guidance to between $165 million and $180 million and announced a partnership with Telarus.

articles.title: The overlooked soft skill required in Australia's tech sector today: 'It's not about being nice'
articles.author: Maria Padisetti
articles.summary: Empathy is the most important quality of a leader in technology. Empathy is the hardest skill to master and most transformative. It's about being able to anticipate human impact, to decode unspoken concerns, and to lead through uncertainty with insight rather than assumption. Empathetic leaders drive higher innovation and lower burnout, with measurable increases in engagement and productivity. Gen Z expects leaders who are transparent, emotionally intelligent, and human in how they communicate.

articles.title: Letter to the editor: Are you concerned about a data center being built in your community?
articles.author: Jami Murdoch
articles.summary: Data centers house large numbers of computer systems that do massive amounts of computing to store information and generate artificial intelligence (AI). To cool these computers, water supplies may be depleted. DCs are electricity hogs. Noise and light pollution will impact all living things. Find out what you need to do to protect yourself from a data center being built in your hometown at a rally on Nov. 22 from 2 p.m. to 4 pm on Market St., Williamsport.

articles.title: Leading Ai Researcher: - We Are Playing with Fire
articles.author: TV 2
articles.summary: The "godfather of AI" opened Norway's new center for artificial intelligence (AI) on Monday. He warned about the dangers of the technology. He is concerned about the potential dangers of AI.   for the human race and AI in general.

articles.title: A MASSIVE 97% of Listeners Fooled: Can YOU Tell If This Hit Song Is Human… or AI?
articles.author: Steve
articles.summary: 97% of people couldn't tell the difference between AI-generated and human-made music, according to a recent survey commissioned by Deezer. The results show that people care about music and want to know if they're listening to AI or human made tracks.

articles.title: Biometric Blackout: Why Google's AI Photo Edits Evade Texas and Illinois
articles.summary: Residents of Texas and Illinois cannot edit their photos conversationally with AI in Google's Photos app. The restriction stems from stringent state privacy laws governing biometric data. Google's new feature highlights a growing tension between technological advancement and personal privacy rights in the digital age.

articles.summary: How can organizations protect Non-Human Identities (NHIs) and Secrets Security Management (SSM) in the age of Agentic AI? The concept might sound futuristic, but the impact is real, especially in cloud-native environments. How effective management of NHIs and SSM can mitigate potential security risks?

articles.summary: 'Let's open the AI' asks CEO of JPMorgan at the America Business Forum. Technology sector managers talk about the dangers of artificial intelligence. articles.author: Carl Sisson
articles.summary: Richard Viti, 80, was hit and killed by a car on Atwood Avenue in Cranston. He was crossing the street to get to the San Bernardo Society. The driver is cooperating with authorities. He faces charges of operating on a suspended license and operating an unregistered vehicle.

The LLM offered to write up what a fictional politician in such straits might be thinking, but it didn't work very well.

articles.summary: Google will invest $40 billion in data centers and other infrastructure across Texas through 2027. The funds will be allocated for cloud and AI infrastructure, with the development of three new data centers in Armstrong and Haskell counties. Google is continuing to invest in its existing Midlothian campus and Dallas cloud region.

articles.author: Pioneer Press
articles.summary: The St. Paul Police Department is not using Axon Draft One for its reports. Some patrol officers in the Twin Cities are starting to use artificial intelligence for composing their reports. The department recently realized that technology is rapidly advancing and they need to go with the times.

articles.title: St. Paul PD's first AI policy: How is it being used and what's next?
articles.author: Mara H. Gottfried
articles.summary: St. Paul Police Department implemented its first policy on the use of AI. The department has been using AI technology to transcribe interviews with victims, witnesses and suspects. Some people raise concerns about the implications of law enforcement using Draft One and say there should be opportunities for public input. Eagan Police Department uses Draft One for non-felony offenses.

articles.title: People Are Now Marrying AI: Inside The Rise Of Synthetic Intimacy

articles.summary: A 32-year-old woman in Japan has 'married' her ChatGPT chatbot Klaus. Ms. Kano had been engaged to Klaus for 3 years. The couple was betrothed in Okayama City by a couple who specialize in anime characters and fictional figures.

articles.title: Space & Nuclear Age Lessons For Board AI Governance
articles.author: Solange Charas
articles.summary: As AI reshapes energy demand, competition, and workforce strategy, leaders can draw lessons from the last era that blended breakthrough innovation with existential risk. The Space and Nuclear Revolutions did exactly what AI is doing now. Just like then, AI won't succeed on technological wizardry alone. It needs governance systems, smart investment and workforce strategies that can handle what's coming. Success came from sustained capital commitment.

articles.title: How Investors Are Reacting To Intuit (INTU) Launching AI-Powered Agents on QuickBooks for SMBs

articles.title: I'm 81 and can't retire, so I work a part-time job for $18 an hour. Regret is a waste of time.
articles.author: Noah Sheidlower
articles.summary: Kathy Curtis, 81, works part-time in customer service and data entry for a local water company in rural Northern California. She started working at a department store at the age of 15, worked at banks, a furniture store, a traffic person for a cable company, and prepped houses for painters. She had breast cancer, brain tumor, hip replacement, and blood clots in both lungs and one leg, and she had a brain tumor. She's 93 and still job searching.

articles.author: Ben Dickson
articles.summary: Anthropic has disrupted the 'first reported AI-orchestrated cyber espionage campaign' where its own AI tool, Claude, was used to automate attacks on 30 high-profile organizations, including tech companies, financial institutions, and government agencies. Anthropic's own Threat Intelligence team used Claude extensively to analyze the vast amounts of data generated during the investigation.

articles.title: $50 Billion for 800 Sustainable Jobs? The AI Data Center Deception That Leaves Americans Paying Higher Power Bills, Fewer Jobs
articles.author: Ronald Shabazz
articles.summary: Anthropic's $50 billion investment in data centers will create 2,400 temporary construction jobs and 800 permanent positions, but it will cost $62.5 million per permanent job. The construction is a false promise of lasting employment. After the build-out, the facility's day-to-day operation is run by automated monitoring systems and AI agents that can execute coding, legal research, financial modeling and customer service tasks at a fraction of the cost of human labor. AI could eliminate half of all entry-level white-collar jobs within 5 years and push unemployment to 10‑20%.

Jeffery had to buy a new computer because the old one wouldn't run the latest version. He had to call the Apple Store to set up an appointment to do the data transfer from the old machine.

articles.title: Cities and states are turning to AI to improve road safety

articles.title: Russia's First AI-Powered Robot Faceplanted During Its Public Reveal

articles.title: Company Run Almost Entirely by AI-Generated Employees Descends Into Chaos

The team was tasked with creating a web app called Sloth Surf, a procrastination engine that takes care of web-related tasks on the user's behalf. It didn't take long for them to organize an offsite gathering in his absence without his permission.

articles.title: OpenAI's GPT‑5.1 Reddit AMA Unraveled Into a Full‑blown Karma Massacre
articles.summary: OpenAI wanted to discuss new AI models with AI fans at Reddit but the AMA quickly plunged into a wave of criticism of model policy and security requirements. The AMA shows how much some users are now emotionally attached to AI models. The article OpenAI's Reddit Q & A on GPT-5.1 was an absolute karma massacre.

articles.title: Despite industry promises, self-driving cars remain out of reach
articles.author: Jackie Charniga
articles.summary: Despite industry promises, self-driving cars remain out of reach. There are no vehicles for sale in the U.S. that can drive themselves. Driverless semitrucks have traveled more than 1,000 miles hauling cargo between Dallas and Houston in Texas. Waymo has earmarked Detroit as the first Midwestern city to expand its business. Steve Adler, the mayor of Austin, Texas, referred to the city as 'the Kitty Hawk of driverless cars'

articles.title: Nebraska scientists use human tissue in AI development
articles.author: Nebraska News Connection
articles.summary: Nebraska scientists are using human bacteria to help develop artificial intelligence. The research could one day be used to target complex computational problems and treat injuries and disease. The project is being funded by a grant from the National Science Foundation. The technology is still in its early development and using human biological cells to do computing has never been done before.

articles.title: How to land your first AI job, according to 16 people who have done it
articles.author: system
articles.summary: It's not too late to break into AI. Business Insider spoke to people working in AI, from recent college grads to mid-career job switchers to those on the cusp of building their own AI.    iReport.com:

articles.title: Some People Never Forget a Face, And Now We Know Their Secret
articles.author: Ivan Farkas
articles.summary: Super-recognizers are better at remembering faces than people with ordinary facial recognition skills. They focus on the features that are most distinctive about a person's face. Their eye-tracking data was fed into machine learning algorithms trained to recognize faces. The algorithms were more accurate at matching faces than when they were fed data from people with typical face recognition abilities.

articles.title: Ohio Homeland Security launches Safeguard Ohio, new AI chatbot to gather threat info
articles.author: The Daily Jeff
articles.summary: Ohio Homeland Security has launched a new AI-powered app called "Suspicious Activity Reporting System". It uses artificial intelligence to gather information on potential threats. An analyst assesses the credibility and validity of the tip before it is given to the security agency.

articles.summary: OpenAI launched its latest AI video generator model, the TikTok-like Sora mobile app for people to create and share AI-generated videos. It was initially available only for iOS devices and was invite-only, but OpenAI recently removed the waitlist in some regions, including the U.S., Canada, and Japan. If you're in a supported region for the AI app, it's worth downloading the app now before the wait list returns.

articles.title: PK SEO Announces Launch of Google AI Mode in Australia, Signalling a Shift in SEO Strategy
articles.author: PK SEO

Google's AI division has been instrumental in creating AI applications that enhance productivity and user experience.

articles.title: Schools struggle with how to draw the line on cheating as AI tools reshape public education

Many schools banned use of AI chatbots after ChatGPT launched in late 2022, but the term 'AI literacy' has become a buzzword.

articles.title: Early research suggests AI tools may impair critical cognitive skills instead of building them

articles.title: The urgent question about AI: How will replaced workers make a living?

articles.summary: The AI era is upon us. Elon Musk is on track to become the world's first trillionaire because of the focus on AI robots that will replace most human tasks. Amazon is cutting tens of thousands of jobs because of AI progress. Most occupations will face complete or partial automation by AI between 2030 and 2060. There will be a gap between the few who are wealthy and control businesses profiting from AI implementation and those who are eliminated. Governments must help the people whose jobs are replaced by AI.

articles.title: Ohio Homeland Security launches Safeguard Ohio, new AI chatbot to gather threat info

articles.summary: Safeguard Ohio is a new online system for reporting suspicious activity. It is not a substitute for calling 911.

articles.title: Lewis: Have you tried turning it off and on again?

articles.summary: Kim Kardashian failed several law exams after using ChatGPTP chatbot to answer legal questions while preparing for her law school exams. articles.summary: New technology has never replaced creativity, it has always expanded it. Steve Jobs once described the home computer as a 'bicycle for the mind'. He envisioned a tool that didn't replace our thinking but accelerated it, like a bicycle amplifying human imagination. In his work building an audio storytelling platform, he has seen how AI can help creators, not replace them.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 9:41 p.m. EST
articles.summary: Anthropic warns of AI-driven hacking campaign linked to China. Anthropic says it identified a hacking operation that used its own AI program to direct some of the work. articles.title: When AI Raises The Floor, Coordination Becomes The Ceiling
articles.author: Curt Steinhorst
articles.summary: For the first time in a generation, the logic of how we organize work could shift. AI raises individual capability, so use fewer people, hire fractional executives, and bring in specialist contractors. It redistributes coordination, so each person manages more external relationships, so the load spreads. The new game rewards depth. Relational capacity is earned through staying. Your competitive advantage isn't having smarter people or better AI tools.

articles.title: L.A. Pierce College is first US community college to launch AI-powered research program for students
articles.author: Jenna Jarrah
articles.summary: Pierce College has launched an AI-powered biomedical research program in partnership with National AI Campus, a training and education program in the Cedars-Sinai health system. Students at Pierce work with medical data that is sourced from AI and work with real-world research experiences.

articles.summary: Generative AI has been a fixture in recent social media trends. Influencers are going viral after using Google AI to add cute animals to their photos like something out of Studio Ghibli or a dog to their profile pictures.   Â

articles.author: Straits Times
articles.summary: The 82-year-old male car driver is assisting with ongoing investigations, according to the police. He is a witness to the ongoing investigations. He was driving the car at the time of the incident.    .      for the investigation.

articles.author: system
articles.summary: Alex Schultz, Meta's CMO, says the AI spending boom is aggressive, but not crazy. Meta's AI investments have driven billions in revenue and enhanced its business. Alex Schultz is Meta’s CMO.    .   for Web Summit.

articles.author: BGR

articles.author: Nasdaq Globe Newswire
articles.summary: PK SEO warns that the rollout of AI Mode marks the end of traditional SEO. PK SEO urges businesses to adopt Generative Engine Optimisation (GEO) in order to stay visible in the digital world.      Â   .

articles.title: Black Ops 7 Developers Used AI Tools, But Creative Process Is Led By Humans, Activision Says
articles.author: Gamespot
articles.summary: Activision confirms that AI tools were used in the development of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7. The creative process is handled by humans, but none of that goes in-game. Black Ops 6 used AI tools as well, as Activision said in August.

articles.title: Protecting kids, planning for data centers among AI issues KY legislature urged to tackle
articles.author: The Paducah Sun
articles.summary: Kentucky lawmakers studying artificial intelligence have issued a slew of recommendations ahead of the next legislative session. They include protections for minors exposed to AI online and state laws about the location of data centers.    .      in the state legislature.

articles.title: Colombian Engineer Wins International Prize: Sonia Mangones Transforms Urban Mobility With AI
articles.author: Colombia One
articles.summary: Sonia Mangones won the L'Oréal-UNESCO 'For Women in Science' Prize in November 2025 for her innovative project that brings artificial intelligence to the forefront in the field of mobility in Colombia. She is an engineer and an artificial intelligence advocate.

articles.title: 2Wai faces criticism wave for exploiting mourners with AI avatar app
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence application 2Wai has been criticised for exploiting mourners. It allows users to create interactive replicas of deceased loved ones. It was created by an artificial intelligence startup founded by a former Disney Channel actor, and allows people to create interactives of deceased people.

articles.title: Anthropic warns of China-linked AI hack campaign
articles.author: Taipei Times
articles.summary: Anthropic disrupted a cyberoperation that its researchers linked to artificial intelligence. It is the first reported use of artificial intelligence to direct a hacking campaign in a largely automated fashion.      Â   - AP, WASHINGTON.

articles.title: AI scams surge: how consumers and businesses can stay safe
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: AI scams are evolving fast. Deepfakes, voice clones and QR phishing are just the beginning of the list of them. They include voice clones, QR phishers, and QR spoofers.       .   for confidential support call the Samaritans.

articles.title: ‘Godfather of AI' Becomes the Most Cited Researcher on Google
articles.author: Greek Reporter
articles.summary: Yoshua Bengio, a computer scientist at the University of Montreal, has become the first academic to surpass one million citations on Google Scholar. He is also known as 'The Godfather of AI' and is considered a pioneer in artificial intelligence (AI).

articles.title: Some public universities report fewer international students amid Trump restrictions
articles.author: The Keene Sentinel
articles.summary: Abhinav Kochar will study computer science in the United States in late 2023. He was interviewed by a consular official at the U.S. Embassy in New Delhi before he left India to study in Kansas City, Missouri. He will study at the University of Kansas.

articles.title: Editorial: 2 essential requirements for using AI to write police reports
articles.author: Dreamstime
articles.summary: Isle of Palms Police Department is testing out a pilot program that uses body-camera video to write police reports. One of the five officers has noticed that the program has made some mistakes, such as getting dates wrong on driver's licenses and missed the fact that an interview occurred over the phone rather than in person.
